intro: Isopteryx longirostris, commonly known as the long-beaked hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has elongated, slender leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
